detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This course replaces MICB 201 effective 2022W.  MICB 211 is credit-excluded with MICB 201.  MICB 211 is the pre-requisite course for MICB 301, MICB 308 and MICB 325.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This course replaces MICB 202 effective 2022W.  MICB 212 is credit-excluded with MICB 202.  MICB 212 is the pre-requisite course for MICB 302 and MICB 306.  This mode of delivery for lectures is in-person.  Tutorials will be online and scheduled at the start of term.  Registration questions should be directed to Dr. Kion, tkion@mail.ubc.ca.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: - Students must register for both Lecture and Lab in order to complete registration for the course. The lab section is a placeholder; you will only need to attend the course.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Please note that you will be required to register for this lab accompanying the course, despite the fact there is no lab offered at this time. Please register for the course and lab; you will just need to attend the course.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Restricted to BMUS COMP majors only.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Open to undergraduate non-composition majors by permission of instructor. For permission to register, contact Dr. Dorothy Chang at dorothy.chang(at)ubc.ca.Weekly 30-minute tutorial instruction will be scheduled. Students in 207C are also required to attend the Monday noon composition seminars.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Must read music. It is recommended that students who take this course have completed MUSC 101 and MUSC 121, or if not, get approval from the instructor.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Restricted to BMUS OPER, or DMPS students. Open to other students by permission of the instructor.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Restricted to BMUS PIAN majors only.  Offered in even academic years (alternates with 136C).

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Further development of skills and performance practice related to vocal and instrumental collaborations for pianists. Emphasis on the study of several major song cycles as well as selected other repertoire. 1-hour Lecture plus individual coachings.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Restricted to BMUS students. Registration is only by recommendation of the Keyboard Division after the piano placement process.

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
